definition: engaged in or accustomed to close observation, an automatic signal (usually a sound) warning of danger, to warn or arouse to a sense of danger or call to a state of preparedness
details:
adjective
- engaged in or accustomed to close observation
= example: engaged in or accustomed to close observation
= synonyms: watchful
- mentally perceptive and responsive
= example: mentally perceptive and responsive
= synonyms: alive, awake
- quick and energetic
= synonyms: rattling
noun
- an automatic signal (usually a sound) warning of danger
= synonyms: alarm, warning signal, alarum
- a warning serves to make you more alert to danger
= synonyms: alerting
- condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action
= example: condition of heightened watchfulness or preparation for action
= synonyms: qui vive
verb
- to warn or arouse to a sense of danger or call to a state of preparedness
= example: to warn or arouse to a sense of danger or call to a state of preparedness
= synonyms: alarm
